Maybe a few bullet points. You know, just a quick list of the key benefits.</p><p name=\"28ed\" id=\"28ed\" class=\"graf graf--p graf-after--p\">Stop. Hey. HEY. STOP TYPING. Keep it simple.</p><h4 name=\"632a\" id=\"632a\" class=\"graf graf--h4 graf-after--p\"><strong class=\"markup--strong markup--h4-strong\">Helpful reminder #2: Embrace the negative.</strong></h4><p name=\"29cd\" id=\"29cd\" class=\"graf graf--p graf-after--h4\">Snowbird knows they have a tough mountain. It\u2019s kind of their thing. The weakness Greg documented in his review is actually one of the main positives of the entire resort, so they decided to have some fun with it.</p><p name=\"00e8\" id=\"00e8\" class=\"graf graf--p graf-after--p\">And speaking of negatives, let\u2019s talk self-deprecation for a second. It\u2019s so hard to do well. Too much or too little of it is a massive turnoff. Somehow, this ad manages to be self-deprecating, humble and thoroughly confident all at once. It\u2019s a remarkable balancing act. Ads like this don\u2019t happen often, but when they do, they spark the same reaction in all of us: \u201cI have to find out more about these guys.\u201d</p><h4 name=\"e75b\" id=\"e75b\" class=\"graf graf--h4 graf-after--p\"><strong class=\"markup--strong markup--h4-strong\">Helpful reminder #3: Cherish your adventurous clients.</strong></h4><p name=\"9562\" id=\"9562\" class=\"graf graf--p graf-after--h4\">Do you know how many marketing directors either A) kill your 1-star testimonial idea instantly, or B) drown it with hundreds of additional words? Because the answer is all of them. They all do it.</p><p name=\"0c24\" id=\"0c24\" class=\"graf graf--p graf-after--p\">If you\u2019re a creative who\u2019s actually worth your paycheck, you have 1-star ideas all the time. Problem is, they\u2019re often murdered by a committee who eventually just shouts \u201cHEY MORON PLEASE BUY THIS AND BY THE WAY HAVE WE TOLD YOU HOW MUCH WE CARE ABOUT YOU\u201d to their audience.</p><p name=\"c018\" id=\"c018\" class=\"graf graf--p graf-after--p\">Snowbird knows their voice, they know their market and they knew an ad like this would resonate. So they ran with it.</p><p name=\"6410\" id=\"6410\" class=\"graf graf--p graf-after--p\">If you have a client like this, one who loves your daring concepts and isn\u2019t afraid to do something different, don\u2019t ever let go of them. Cherish them. Love them. Tell them how thankful you are that they exist. They\u2019re beautiful little unicorns and you don\u2019t deserve them.</p><h4 name=\"3c3e\" id=\"3c3e\" class=\"graf graf--h4 graf-after--p\">Shameless plug:</h4><p name=\"62d3\" id=\"62d3\" class=\"graf graf--p graf-after--h4 graf--trailing\">The agency I actually <em class=\"markup--em markup--p-em\">do</em> work for has a brand new website. We come to work every day with the belief that B2B marketing doesn\u2019t have to be a snooze. <a href=\"http://www.ivorandrew.com/\" data-href=\"http://www.ivorandrew.com/\" class=\"markup--anchor markup--p-anchor\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\" target=\"_blank\">Check it out here</a>, have a look around and feel free to leave us a 1-star review.</p></div></div></body></html>"}, "15429516": {"score": 1, "comments": [], "time": "2017-10-08 22:21:37", "url": "http://artslooker.com/en/top-10-kyiv-art-galleries-and-centers-of-contemporary-art/", "text": "<html><body><div><div class=\"post-body clearfix\">&#13;\n&#13;\n                                    &#13;\n&#13;\n                                                                        &#13;\n&#13;\n                                    &#13;\n                                    <p><img class=\"alignnone size-full wp-image-9403\" src=\"http://artslooker.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/02/658x348_e.jpg\" alt=\"658x348_e\" srcset=\"http://artslooker.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/02/658x348_e-300x159.jpg 300w, http://artslooker.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/02/658x348_e-620x328.jpg 620w, http://artslooker.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/02/658x348_e.jpg 658w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 658px) 100vw, 658px\"/></p>\n<p><strong><em>After the Orange revolution, in the field of gallery business, reorganization began: the exhibition areas of new formations opened throughout the country. Their agenda is greater now, then that of the national museums or art boutiques, and the grounds offer a maximally understandable form of communication by itself to the audience. </em></strong><em><strong>New galleries of contemporary art quickly form their own audience, turning the client and visitor into an integral part of the art process</strong><strong>. F</strong><strong>requent changes of expositions, arts literature publishing, actions, lectures and evenings with artists contributed to their greater popularity. Each of such areas has its own art policy, development strategy, circle of friends. However, the place of\u00a0 a gallery in the cultural process is precisely determined by the arts quality represented in its walls, the number of events in which it just happened to participate and also by the ability to combine educational and commercial activities.</strong><strong>\u00a0</strong></em></p>\n<p><em><strong>The </strong><strong>ArtsLooker editor office offers a short-list of exhibition areas that have appeared on the Kyiv cultural map over the past decade, becoming estimable and powerful players on the native art-stage. The rating was based on the following criteria: exhibition performance activity in Ukraine and abroad, frequency of references in the native and foreign media, territory of art space accommodation and interior, design and convenience of official web-page functionality, and also the numbers of followers and publications activity on the social nets. </strong></em></p>\n<p><strong>1. Pinchuk </strong><strong>Art</strong> <strong>Centre</strong></p>\n<div id=\"attachment_9361\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\"><img class=\"size-full wp-image-9361\" src=\"http://artslooker.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/09/Mecenat-Viktor-Pinchuk.jpg\" alt=\"Victor Pinchuk / Photo: forbes.com\" srcset=\"http://artslooker.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/09/Mecenat-Viktor-Pinchuk-300x172.jpg 300w, http://artslooker.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/09/Mecenat-Viktor-Pinchuk-620x355.jpg 620w, http://artslooker.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/09/Mecenat-Viktor-Pinchuk.jpg 658w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 658px) 100vw, 658px\"/><p class=\"wp-caption-text\">Victor Pinchuk / Photo: forbes.com</p></div>\n<p>With their opening in 2006, <strong>Pinchuk Art </strong><strong>Centre</strong>\u00a0became one of the biggest private contemporary art centers in Central and Western Europe at once. It was created by the Ukrainian philanthrope Victor Pinchuk as the main project of his foundation in the cultural sector.<br/>\nIn February 2011 the art center presented the project \u201cCollectors\u2019 platform\u201d, updated twice a year, the permanent exhibition\u00a0 of selected works of outstanding artists working in the field of contemporary art. In 2007 and 2009 Pinchuk Art Centre organized the official Ukrainian pavilion on 52nd \u0456 53rd Venice Biennale, demonstrating the exposure \u201cPoem about an Inland Sea\u201d and \u00abSteppes of Dreamers\u00bb. In 2011 and 2013 the Victor Pinchuk Foundation presented project \u00abThe Future Generation Art Prize@Venice\u00bb as part of the official parallel programme of Venice Biennale. Over the 11 years of work more than 70 projects were organized by the efforts of the center, most of which are international. As of 2017 more than 3 000\u00a0000 people visited Pinchuk Art Centre.</p>\n<p><em>Address: Kyiv, Velyka Vasylkivska Street/Baseyna/1/3-2, block \u0410, Besarabskiy section.\u00a0www.pinchukartcentre.org</em></p>\n<p><strong>2. Voloshyn\u00a0Gallery\u00a0</strong></p>\n<div id=\"attachment_9363\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\"><img class=\"size-full wp-image-9363\" src=\"http://artslooker.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/09/Galeristi-Maksim-i-YUliya-Voloshini.jpg\" alt=\"ulia and Maxim Voloshyn / Photo: voloshyngallery.com\" srcset=\"http://artslooker.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/09/Galeristi-Maksim-i-YUliya-Voloshini-300x199.jpg 300w, http://artslooker.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/09/Galeristi-Maksim-i-YUliya-Voloshini-620x412.jpg 620w, http://artslooker.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/09/Galeristi-Maksim-i-YUliya-Voloshini.jpg 658w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 658px) 100vw, 658px\"/><p class=\"wp-caption-text\">Julia and Maxim Voloshyn / Photo: voloshyngallery.com</p></div>\n<p>Voloshyn Gallery, which was first called the \u201cArt Collection\u201d, was founded in 2006 by the married couple Julia and Maxim Voloshyn, as a classical art and socialist realism gallery. However, since 2010 the vector of work began to change, and in 2016 the gallery fully rebranded, expanding its own exhibition area and opened as a ground, exhibiting Contemporary art compositions. Voloshyn Gallery cooperates with different generations of artists, among them classics such as Vlada Ralko, Volodymyr Budnikov, Oleksandr Roytburd, Anatoliy Kryvolap, Oleksandr Babak, Igor Gusev, and also such young and famous authors, as Myhailo Deyak, Anna Valiyeva, Mariya Sulymenko, Artem Volokitin, Stepan Ryabchenko. The last few years the gallery also performed pilot projects with the participation of young artists.</p>\n<p>Today the Voloshyn Gallery is one of the most successful galleries in Ukraine, striving to present the works of its artists internationally. In 2015 the gallery carried out an exhibition \u201c8 Contemporary artists\u201d at the Ukrainian Institute of America in New York, USA, in 2014 showed 16 Ukrainian artists in Vienna, Austria and actively participates in international events such as SCOPE Basel 2017, SCOPE New York 2017, SCOPE Miami 2016, SCOPE Basel 2016, IX ART-KYIV Contemporary 2014, Art Monaco 2012.</p>\n<p><em>Address: Kyiv, Tereshchenkivska, 13. www.voloshyngallery.art</em></p>\n<p><strong>3. Shcherbenko Art Centre</strong></p>\n<div id=\"attachment_9365\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\"><img class=\"size-full wp-image-9365\" src=\"http://artslooker.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/09/Galerist-Marina-SHHerbenko.jpg\" alt=\"Maryna Shcherbenko / Photo: bestin.ua\" srcset=\"http://artslooker.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/09/Galerist-Marina-SHHerbenko-300x203.jpg 300w, http://artslooker.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/09/Galerist-Marina-SHHerbenko-620x420.jpg 620w, http://artslooker.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/09/Galerist-Marina-SHHerbenko.jpg 658w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 658px) 100vw, 658px\"/><p class=\"wp-caption-text\">Maryna Shcherbenko / Photo: bestin.ua</p></div>\n<p>Shcherbenko Art Centre was founded in 2012 by Maryna Shcherbenko based on the Bottega Gallery (2008-2014). The art-space chose their primary mission to build a bridge between art professionals and a wider auditory. In 5 years it gained a reputation of the center for the exposition of recognized artists\u2019 works and the research organization studying the experimental art of young artists. Within the Shcherbenko Art Centre the master-classes, lectures are carried out, and also a competition for young artists \u00ab\u041c\u0423\u0425\u0456\u00bb is held. Among the most outstanding projects are: \u00abMoved On!\u00bb, \u00abPaper. Peace. Art\u00bb (at the \u00abKnyzhkovii Arsenal\u00bb festival), \u00abVYTOKY\u00bb (to order of Ukrainian Fashion Week), special project \u00abHistory in dresses. Our fashion from 1990-s\u00bb (to order of\u00a0 \u041darper\u2019s \u0412azaar Ukraine), \u00abMantru get\u2019!\u00bb, \u00abKardynal Richelieu\u00bb by Oleksandr Roytburd, \u00abRefrigerator\u00bb by Vasyl Bagay, \u00abMonochromy\u00bb by Tiberii Silvashi.</p>\n<p><em>Address: Kyiv, Myhailivska, 22-v. www.shcherbenkoartcentre.com</em></p>\n<p><strong>4. Art Ukraine\u00a0</strong><strong>Gallery</strong></p>\n<div id=\"attachment_9367\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\"><img class=\"size-full wp-image-9367\" src=\"http://artslooker.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/09/Natalya-Zabolotna.jpg\" alt=\"Natalya Zabolotna / Photo: artslooker.com\" srcset=\"http://artslooker.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/09/Natalya-Zabolotna-300x192.jpg 300w, http://artslooker.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/09/Natalya-Zabolotna-620x397.jpg 620w, http://artslooker.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/09/Natalya-Zabolotna.jpg 658w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 658px) 100vw, 658px\"/><p class=\"wp-caption-text\">Natalya Zabolotna / Photo: artslooker.com</p></div>\n<p>The head of the gallery, which opened its doors in November, 2016, became Natalya Zabolotna, whose name in society is synonymous with the blossom of Ukrainian Dom and Mystetskii Arsenal. The space with a total area of approximately 800 square meters is situated near the Mariyinskii Park. The gallery immediately became one of the most visited in the capital. Its goal is to interest and make demand for art in all social groups. That\u2019s why except \u00a0for the exhibition and publishing activities, it\u2019s a place for cultural dialogue, educational programs and social initiatives. Permanent expositions are presented on the first floor, which includes works of successful Ukrainian artists: Oleksandr Suholit, Oleksandr Roytburd, Victor Sydorenko, Oleg Tistol, Anatoliy Kryvolap, Roman Minin. The area for presentation of new projects is updated every two months. In the first year Zabolotna presented the personal projects of Stepan Ryabchenko, Vinni Reunov, Arsen Savadov.</p>\n<p><em>Address: Kyiv, Myhaila Grushevskogo, 9-\u0410.\u00a0www.facebook.com/artukrainegallery</em></p>\n<p><strong>\u00a05. Ya Gallery Art Center</strong></p>\n<div id=\"attachment_9374\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\"><img class=\"size-full wp-image-9374\" src=\"http://artslooker.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/09/17721_b_1461750342.jpg\" alt=\"Pavlo Gudimov / Photo: jetsetter.ua\" srcset=\"http://artslooker.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/09/17721_b_1461750342-300x176.jpg 300w, http://artslooker.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/09/17721_b_1461750342-620x365.jpg 620w, http://artslooker.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/09/17721_b_1461750342.jpg 658w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 658px) 100vw, 658px\"/><p class=\"wp-caption-text\">Pavlo Gudimov / Photo: jetsetter.ua</p></div>\n<p>\u00abYa Gallery Art Center\u00bb was opened in the spring of 2007 by curator, musician (\u201cOkean Elzy\u201d) and collector Pavlo Gudimov. Later with support of collector Pavlo Martynov an affiliate of the center \u201cI am GALLERY\u201d was opened in Dnipro. Popularization of modern art, implementing by the way of carrying out of exhibitions, lectures, conferences and by the way of publishing of their own art books, became the mission of the organization. The art-center founded their own award programme, and also the project-investigation of unexplored territory of urban native Ukrainian art. \u00abI am Gallery\u00bb regularly participates in such events as: ART-KYIV Contemporary, fine art fair ART MOSCOW, modern art festival GOGOLFEST and ARTVILNIUS, the Night of Museums in Ukraine and abroad. Among the permanent artists of the \u00abI am Gallery\u00bb are 63 artists. The most famous are Pavlo Makov, Oleksandr Suholit, Tiberii Silvashi , Vlada Ralko, Anton Logov.</p>\n<p><em>Address: Kyiv, Horyva, 49-B. www.yagallery.com</em></p>\n<p><strong>6. Exhibition center </strong><strong>\u00abGolden Section</strong><strong>\u00bb</strong></p>\n<div id=\"attachment_9376\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\"><img class=\"size-full wp-image-9376\" src=\"http://artslooker.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/09/4.jpg\" alt=\"Co-Founder of auction House &quot;Golden Section&quot; Mykhailo Vasylenko / Photo: artslooker.com\" srcset=\"http://artslooker.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/09/4-300x222.jpg 300w, http://artslooker.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/09/4-620x459.jpg 620w, http://artslooker.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/09/4.jpg 658w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 658px) 100vw, 658px\"/><p class=\"wp-caption-text\">Co-Founder of auction House \u201cGolden Section\u201d Mykhailo Vasylenko / Photo: artslooker.com</p></div>\n<p>\u00abGolden Section\u00bb is a new gallery, founded on the base of an auction house carrying the same name, which was established in 2004. The art space specializes in exhibition activities and the sale of neo-classical paintings, avant-garde, nonconformism, underground, object design, photography, and Russian orthodox icons. Herewith the center delivers presentations, antiquarian and topic exhibitions and auctions. Working in two directions (as an auction house and art gallery), \u00abGolden ratio\u00bb achieves a complex result, which allows it to carry out approximately 4 auctions and 4 topic exhibitions every year. The best known projects of 2017 are \u201cGraphics of the Ukrainian artists of 1950-80-s\u201d and \u201cUkrainian underground\u201d.</p>\n<p><em>Address: Kyiv, Leonida Pervomayskogo, 4. www.ua.gs-art.com</em></p>\n<p><strong>7. Triptych Art</strong></p>\n<div id=\"attachment_9382\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\"><img class=\"size-full wp-image-9382\" src=\"http://artslooker.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/09/5ee733a27a71ca937973ef3da6e6b7f9f0108137.jpg\" alt=\"Tanya Savchenko / Photo: capital.ua\" srcset=\"http://artslooker.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/09/5ee733a27a71ca937973ef3da6e6b7f9f0108137-300x183.jpg 300w, http://artslooker.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/09/5ee733a27a71ca937973ef3da6e6b7f9f0108137-620x377.jpg 620w, http://artslooker.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/09/5ee733a27a71ca937973ef3da6e6b7f9f0108137.jpg 657w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 657px) 100vw, 657px\"/><p class=\"wp-caption-text\">Tanya Savchenko / Photo: capital.ua</p></div>\n<p>The Kyiv gallery \u00abTriptych Art\u00bb was founded on the base of the first private Ukrainian gallery, opened in 1988, supervised by the gallerist Tanya Savchenko from 1999. At that time it existed on Andrew\u2019s Descent under the name \u201cTriptych\u201d,\u00a0 and later opened its doors under the name \u00abTriptych Art\u00bb on the Desyatynna Street. The gallery earned its reputation in the art-space and the circle of fans during 25 years of seminal work. Sincerity in choosing of authors and works of art remains the basic principle of the space\u2019s work. You can find here the best names of Ukrainian art-space, the history of modern art would be incomplete without them, presentied in the gallery. \u00abTriptych ART\u00bb forms the private and corporate collections.</p>\n<p><em>Address: Kyiv, Desyatynna Street 13. www.triptych-art.com</em></p>\n<p><strong>8. \u00ab</strong><strong>Dukat</strong><strong>\u00bb</strong><strong> Gallery</strong></p>\n<div id=\"attachment_9384\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\"><img class=\"size-full wp-image-9384\" src=\"http://artslooker.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/09/IMG_8179.jpg\" alt=\"Leonid Komskii / Photo: artslooker.com\" srcset=\"http://artslooker.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/09/IMG_8179-300x200.jpg 300w, http://artslooker.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/09/IMG_8179-620x413.jpg 620w, http://artslooker.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/09/IMG_8179.jpg 658w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 658px) 100vw, 658px\"/><p class=\"wp-caption-text\">Leonid Komskii / Photo: artslooker.com</p></div>\n<p>The exhibition area, created in 2015 on the base of an auction house of the same name, the founder of which became Leonid Komskii (2009). The competence of \u00abDukat\u00bb is a non-official postwar and \u0441ontemporary art. The area combines a gallery and educational activities. The established Education platform is conducive to the popularization of Ukrainian art by the way of carrying out lectures, professional discussions and meet-the-artist events. The primary mission of the organization is giving the opportunity to the visitor to participate directly in the art-process. Except for the auctions, \u00abDukat\u00bb organizes artistic actions, film shows, fairs, exhibitions, among which\u00a0 personal projects of Oleksandr Roytburd, Matvii Vaysberg, Yuriy Pikul, Vladyslav Shereshevskii can be found.</p>\n<p><em>Address: Kyiv, Reytarska, 8-B.\u00a0www.facebook.com/dykatgallery</em></p>\n<p><strong>9. Dymchuk\u00a0Gallery</strong></p>\n<div id=\"attachment_9386\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\"><img class=\"size-full wp-image-9386\" src=\"http://artslooker.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/09/Galerist-Anatoliy-Dimchuk.jpg\" alt=\"Anatoliy Dymchuk / Photo: capital.ua\" srcset=\"http://artslooker.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/09/Galerist-Anatoliy-Dimchuk-300x182.jpg 300w, http://artslooker.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/09/Galerist-Anatoliy-Dimchuk-620x377.jpg 620w, http://artslooker.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/09/Galerist-Anatoliy-Dimchuk.jpg 658w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 658px) 100vw, 658px\"/><p class=\"wp-caption-text\">Anatoliy Dymchuk / Photo: capital.ua</p></div>\n<p>Dymchuk Gallery was created in 2008 by Ukrainian cultural figure and collector Anatoliy Dymchuk. It has the modern Ukrainian art, transavantgarde, Odessan conceptual art and nonconformism among its interests. For today Dymchuk Gallery is one of the few galleries, carrying the intense international activity, participating in fairs, fora and biennale, among which: KUNSTART 2009 (Bolzano), ART KYIV \u0421ontemporary 2009, 2010, 2011, 2012 (Kyiv), the First Kyiv International Biennale of Contemporary Art (Kyiv), Berliner Liste 2013 (Berlin), VOLTA 10 (Basel), KOLNER LISTE 2015 (Cologne). Popularization of modern Ukrainian art abroad and creation of demand for it among the European collectors is the goal of the space. The space is known by the personal exhibitions of classics: Oleksandr Roytburd, Oleg Tistol, Illya Chichkan, Mykola Matsenko, Igor Gusev. In only 3 years Dymchuk Gallery realized more then 40 projects, most of which are internationally recognized.</p>\n<p><em>Address: Kyiv, Yaroslavska Street, 21. www.dymchuk.com</em></p>\n<p><strong>10. Center of Contemporary Art \u041c17</strong></p>\n<div id=\"attachment_8793\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\"><img class=\"size-full wp-image-8793\" src=\"http://artslooker.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/08/ShV-35-1721.jpg\" alt=\"The Center of Contemporary Art M17 / Photo: artslooker.com\" srcset=\"http://artslooker.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/08/ShV-35-1721-300x198.jpg 300w, http://artslooker.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/08/ShV-35-1721-620x410.jpg 620w, http://artslooker.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/08/ShV-35-1721.jpg 658w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 658px) 100vw, 658px\"/><p class=\"wp-caption-text\">The Center of Contemporary Art M17 / Photo: artslooker.com</p></div>\n<p>The Center of Contemporary Art M17 was opened in the summer of 2010 for support of modern Ukrainian art. It quickly became one of the most popular Kyiv exhibition grounds, which regular carries out the personal, group, curatorial projects, educational programs, film shows, lectures and master-classes. For today \u041c17 strives to become the epicenter of the events of the capital cultural life. The art-space coordinates with foreign artists and organizations, and also with the Austrian cultural forum and the embassies of France and Georgia. The art boutique \u201cArt in interior\u201d has been a major highlight, as the famous galleries and artists from Ukraine, France and Netherlands presented elegant works, which could be purchased. The artists with exclusive conditions in the center: Mykola Peremyshlev, Anatolii Galytskii, Oleg Pinchuk, Bogdan Tomashevskii. Best known projects for the last year are the personal exhibitions of Ivan Marchuk \u00abMusic on the canvas\u00bb and Zinaida Lihacheva \u00abWhite tears\u00bb.</p>\n<p><em>Address: Kyiv,\u00a0 Antonovycha Street, 102-104. www.m17.kiev.ua</em><br/>\n<br/>\n</p>\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<p class=\"author\">                                       &#13;\n                                        <span> 08.10.2017</span>                                    </p>&#13;\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t&#13;\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t&#13;\n                                    &#13;\n                                </div>&#13;\n&#13;\n                                &#13;\n                            </div></body></html>"}, "15429517": {"score": 4, "comments": ["hello,<p>finding a business &#x2F; domain name is time consuming and can be expensive.<p>we hunt brandable names with available .com domains.<p>this is what we have for a minimum viable product. if there is interest we plan to release daily a list of domains.<p>any feedback is welcome.<p>thanks!", "Great list. "url": "https://ubuntubudgie.org/", "text": "<html><body><div><div class=\"uk-panel uk-panel-header uk-text-center \">\n\n                <h3 class=\"uk-panel-title\">Easy To Use</h3>\n        \n        <center><img src=\"/storage/easy.svg\" alt=\"Easy\"/></center>\n\n<p>    \nFriendly to newcomers from other Operating Systems, programmers and normal users alike. \n   </p>\n\n\n    </div>\n\n</div></body></html>"}, "15430547": {"score": 2, "comments": [], "time": "2017-10-09 02:08:38", "url": "http://art-processor.org/", "text": "<html><body><div><div class=\"articles\">\n  <article class=\"post\">\n    <header>\n      <h1> About ART </h1>\n    </header>\n      <p>ART is a notation to represent families of similar programs as highly parameterized, adaptable templates, for ease of <b>maintenance</b> and <b>reuse</b>. Typically, a program family comprises program versions that evolved from a single original program as new requirements have been implemented to it over time. Each program version addresses a specific customer segment or platform. Such program versions have much in common, but differ in some user requirements or design/implementation details.</p>\n\t  <p>ART provides an end-to- end solution for managing program families that eliminates the need for other mechanisms that are often used for that purpose such as macros or design patterns, and significantly reduces the scope in which we apply configuration management systems.</p>\n    <p>ART templates contain code that is common for all program versions in a family - in parameterized form, for ease of adaptation. ART Processor derives program versions from ART templates, based on specifications of requirements that are specific to a given program version (i.e., requirements that have not been implemented as a common part in ART templates).</p>\n\t  <p>ART can be pictured as an advanced form of macros that evolved into well throughout program instrumentation notation, avoiding well-known pitfalls of macros, and greatly extending their power to tackle problems of program versioning. For example, ART gives a programmer full control over propagation of <span class=\"art-command-span\">#define</span> parameters to included files (<span class=\"art-command-span\">#include</span>) to enhance their reusability. Any similar files (or other program structures) can be represented as generic ART templates from which ART Processor generates concrete program files.</p>\n\t  <p>ART can be also pictured as an advanced template system, where any program structure (not only classes or functions) may become a parameterized template, and where parameters may be just anything we wish \u2013 types, program fragments, files or program structures of any kind and size.</p>\n\t  <p>In SPL (Software Product Line) reuse, ART plays a role of <span class=\"bs-ref-info\">Variability Management Technique (VMT)</span> that handles adaptive changes at the architecture to code. In practical SPL reuse scenarios, we typically use a range of VMTs such as macros, scripts, build tools (Ant or make), design patterns, or commenting out variant/optional code for manual inclusion/exclusion. As ART does what the other VMTs collectively can do, there is no need to use multiple (sometimes incompatible) VMTs.</p>\n      <div class=\"bs-callout bs-callout-info\">\n        <h4>Variability  Management  Techniques  (VMT)</h4>\n        <p>\n        help  developers  manage the  base  code  for  families  of  system variants,  e.g.,  a  family  of  Linux  versions  running  on  various  platforms,  or  financial  systems  used  in  different companies.  VMTs  organize  and/or  instrument  the  base  code  for  ease  of  adaptation  and  reuse.\n        </p>\n      </div>\n\t  <p>ART and its predecessor XVCL have been applied in industrial projects as a variability technique to manage reuse in product lines of web portals, command and control systems, mobile games, information systems, and to eliminate redundancies in software libraries (STL, Buffer).</p>\n \n      <h3>How is ART different from the earlier XVCL?</h3>\n\t  \n\t  <p>ART is an enhanced, lightweight and XML-free version of XVCL. Like XVCL, ART is based on concepts of Bassett\u2019s <span class=\"bs-ref-warning\">Frame Technology<sup>TM</sup></span>.</p>\n      <div class=\"bs-callout bs-callout-warning\">\n        <h4>Frame Technology </h4>\n        <p> is a language-neutral (i.e., processes various languages) system that manufactures custom software from reusable, machine-adaptable building blocks, called frames. FT is used to reduce the time, effort, and errors involved in the design, construction, and evolution of large, complex software systems. \n        </p>\n\t<a href=\"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frame_technology_(software_engineering)\"><i class=\"link-i\">More about FT</i></a>\n      </div>\n\t  <p>ART improves the user experience by providing the following improvements to XVCL</p>\n      <p class=\"listing\">Easy to learn and use: XVCL is a dialect of XML and uses XML trees and a parser for processing</p>\n\t  <p>ART parts with XML syntax and processing. You can define your own syntax for ART commands, to suit your programming environment and taste, and to avoid conflicts with the base languages. As default, ART offers a simple cpp-like syntax.</p>\n\t  <p class=\"listing\">Expanding the customization options under #adapt command</p>\n\t  <p>In XVCL, the only command that you can place under adapt is insert. ART allows to use any command under <span class=\"art-command-span\">#adapt</span>. We found using <span class=\"art-command-span\">#set</span>, <span class=\"art-command-span\">#while</span> and <span class=\"art-command-span\">#select</span> commands under <span class=\"art-command-span\">#adapt</span> to be particularly very useful.</p>\n\t  <p class=\"listing\">Robust structure instead of unreadable loops</p>\n\t  <p>In XVCL, while loops using many multi-value variables can be quite confusing. ART introduces a structure called set-loop which gives the possibility to store and use more multi-value variables together as one loop descriptor data structure.</p>\n\t  <p class=\"listing\">More flexible</p>\n\t  <p>ART is more flexible than XVCL, as it allows the adaptation of a file even though the file might not contain any ART commands. Such adaptation would simply copy the adapted file to the output stream.</p>\n  </article>\n  <article class=\"post\">\n    <header>\n      <h1> How it Works </h1>\n    </header>\n     <p>\n     Like other pre-processors, ART is a text manipulation system. ART Processor reads ART templates (source code files with embedded ART commands), and outputs source code files ready for compilation. ART commands <span class=\"art-command-span\">(#[cmd])</span> are processed, while code is emitted to the output. The processing sequence is defined by ART commands, which will be explained in this tutorial.\n     </p>\n     <div class=\"bs-callout bs-callout-info\">\n         <h4>Adapting input files</h4>\n         <p> To start processing, we feed to ART Processor the specification file called SPC. ART commands in SPC, and in each subsequently processed file (ART template), are processed in the sequence in which they appear. When ART Processor encounters an\u00a0<span class=\"art-command-span\">#adapt</span> <i>f2</i> command while processing file <i>f1</i>, it suspends processing of file <i>f1</i> and starts processing file <i>f2</i>. Once processing of file <i>f2</i> is completed, ART Processor resumes processing of file <i>f1</i> just after\u00a0<span class=\"art-command-span\">#adapt</span> command. In that way the processing ends when the Processor reaches the end of the SPC.</p>\n     </div>\n     <div class=\"img-crop\">\n        <img src=\"../img/adapt.gif\"/>\n     </div>\n     <p>\n     So far, ART\u2019s <span class=\"art-command-span\">#adapt</span> looks like a cpp\u2019s <span class=\"art-command-span\">#inclide</span>. However, there is an important difference: unlike <span class=\"art-command-span\">#include</span>, <span class=\"art-command-span\">#adapt</span> \u201cA\u201d (as the command name suggests) can modify file \u201cA\u201d at the inclusion point, and it can do so differently at differentinclusion points. Many software components have a potential for reuse, but most often they have to be modified to fit a specific reuse context. ART\u2019s <span class=\"art-command-span\">#adapt</span> together with other commands provide a powerful mechanism to do so. Examples that follow explain how this is done.\n     </p>\n  </article>\n  <article class=\"post\">\n    <header>\n      <h1> Usage and Examples </h1>\n    </header>\n    <p>\n      Let's see how ART can be applied with some simple code snippet examples.\n      The ART language like other languages allows us to declare and use variables. Let's look at the following simple example:\n    </p>\n    <h5>ART snippet:</h5>\n    \n    <h5>Result:</h5>\n    \n    <br/>\n    As we can see, variables can be allocated with the <span class=\"art-command-span\">#set</span> command, and <span class=\"art-ref-span\">?@varname?</span>\u00a0retrieves their value.\n    <p> Values of variables propagate to the <span class=\"art-command-span\">#adapt</span>-ed files. Let\u2019s see an example where  <span class=\"art-command-span\">#adapt</span>\u00a0and\u00a0<span class=\"art-command-span\">#set</span> are used together, allowing for a simple form of adaptive reuse of files:</p>\n    <h5>ART snippet:</h5>\n    \n    <h5>template.art:</h5>\n    \n    <h5>Result:</h5>\n    \n    <br/>\n    <p>A template is reusable program component: First we set up values for variables (template parameters), then we <span class=\"art-command-span\">#adapt</span> a template with our variables to get the result we were expecting. </p>\n    <p>Since the template does not know about our specific settings, we can (re)use it in other contexts, with different values of variables, without any changes done to the template. I can <span class=\"art-command-span\">#adapt</span> a template with my own set of values, and my neighbour can <span class=\"art-command-span\">#adapt</span> it with his own set of values, and we both get the output we wanted, without making any changes to the template.\n    </p><h4>Multi-value variables and loops in ART</h4>\n    <p>We can give multiple values to a variable with a <span class=\"art-command-span\">#set</span> command, by defining the values separated by comma. These variables in ART are called multi-variables or multi-value variables.<br/>ART's <span class=\"art-command-span\">#while</span> command will let us loop over the values of a multi-value variable. Example:</p>\n    <h5>ART snippet:</h5>\n    \n    <h5>template.art:</h5>\n    \n    <h5>Result:</h5>\n    \n    <br/>\n    <p>ART templates not only let us generate source code from reusing templates, but grealy hepl in maintenance and code evolution as well.<br/>Let's say we need to add another class to our example called <i>'Mage'</i>. To do that we only need to make a very small change in our definition and we don't need to change the template code at all. The change is the following:</p>\n    <h5>ART snippet (added Mage class and values):</h5>\n    \n    <h5>template.art (all the same, no change):</h5>\n    <h5>Result:</h5>\n    \n    <br/>\n    <p>This way ART can greatly boost our productivity and we don't need to worry about copy-paste errors or similar inconsistencies caused by user-error.</p>\n    <p>Let's add another small change to our code! Say some warrior classes will have special attack, some will not have, and the ones who have, can have different ones.</p>\n    <p>We need to learn two new commands for this. We will use the <span class=\"art-command-span\">#insert</span> - <span class=\"art-command-span\">#break</span> mechanism</p>\n    <p>Our template will have a <b>breakpoint</b> where we can extend with additional content from our <b>specification</b>, meaning, we can change the template from outside the template without affecting others. Let's see:</p>\n    <h5>the new template.art:</h5>\n    \n  <h5>the new spec file:</h5>\n  \n  <p class=\"bs-callout bs-callout-info\">\n  Later we will show better ways of injecting code, now we used a simple <span class=\"art-command-span\">#if</span> command and matching the class name.\n  </p>\n  <h5>Result:</h5>\n    \n    <br/>\n    <p>Of course, there is much more in ART, however with these essential features and mechanism we can get a great deal of productivity out of it, if used in the correct way. Take a look at the <a href=\"learn\">Learn</a> section to see more examples and explanations of ART commands.</p>\n    <p>Read on if you want to know more about ART in general.</p>\n  </article>\n  <article class=\"post\">\n    <header>\n      <h1>Get ART, Run ART</h1>\n    </header>\n     <p>\n        You can download the ART processor and examples from <a href=\"http://sourceforge.net/projects/vclang\">this link</a>. The package contains instructions on how to execute the processor.\n        To run the processor on your machine you will need an installed JRE on the computer. You can get it <a href=\"http://java.com/en/download/index.jsp\">from here.</a>\n     </p>\n     <p>\n        You can run snippet codes online on <a href=\"http://fiddle.art-processor.org\">ARTFiddle</a>. You can write ART code and execute it on out remote computer which will give you the result after executing your code. In this way for executing ART processor you only need internet connection. ARTFiddle has many toturials you can execute, modify to help you learn and understand how it works. The snippets you are running will get a unique code and can be kept and shared by link. Visit ARTFiddle to find out more.\n     </p>\n  </article>\n  <article class=\"post\" id=\"publications\">\n    <header>\n      <h1> Publications </h1>\n    </header>\n    <h4><i class=\"fa fa-newspaper-o\" aria-hidden=\"true\"/>\u00a0\u00a0<i class=\"fa\"/> Managing Big Clones to Ease Evolution: Linux Kernel Example</h4>\n    <p class=\"conf-p\">36th IEEE Software Engineering Workshop, Federated Conference on Computer Science and Information Systems (FEDCIS)</p>\n    <p class=\"time-p\">Jul. 2016</p>\n    <p class=\"authors-p\">\n       <i class=\"fa fa-user\" aria-hidden=\"true\"/>\u00a0\u00a0 Kuldeep Kumar Garg - With 22,000 people attending the concert that Stephen Paddock opened fire on, the loss and devastation of the hundreds injured and the dozens dead has been felt around the country. One group personally close to home that has been affected is The Walt Disney Company.</p>\n\n<p>Disney\u2019s CEO &amp; Chairman, Bob Iger, summed up the impact in an email he sent to all cast on Monday morning: </p>\n<blockquote>\n<p>In the wake of the tragic events in Las Vegas last night, our hearts go out to everyone impacted by the violence \u2013 the victims, the witnesses, and the friends and families mourning loved ones.</p>\n\n<p>As news of the event continues to unfold, we are devastated to learn that a valued member of our own Disney family, Carrie Barnette, was among those killed in the Las Vegas shooting.  Carrie was part of our culinary team at Disney California Adventure, most recently working at Flo\u2019s V-8 Caf\u00e9 in Cars Land.  She just celebrated her 10th anniversary at Disney earlier this year.  We\u2019re in touch with her family, offering our heartfelt condolences as well as any support they may need in this incredibly difficult time.</p>\n\n<p>Jessica Milam, an attraction hostess at Tomorrowland in Disneyland, was also seriously injured.  She is currently hospitalized, and I ask that you join me in praying for her swift and complete recovery.  </p>\n\n<p>I know we have many more Disney employees impacted by this latest act of senseless violence, who were either onsite or had loved ones who were.  Our hearts are with each of them as they begin to process this terrifying experience.</p>\n\n<p>Bob</p>\n</blockquote>\n<p>Other emails were sent out to all cast by other high-level Leaders, but Iger\u2019s sums it up in so many words.</p>\n\n<p>Around 70 cast members in total were in Las Vegas, with many being affected \u2013 directly and indirectly \u2013 by the event. Some of them are my personal friends, coworkers, and even my current Leader, Alondra Preciad. Alondra, and others, had been talking about their trips for weeks; some cast were going for the concerts, some for a bachelorette party, and others just to go enjoy their weekend. When news of the shooting broke, my heart followed.</p>\n\n<p>The returned cast that I\u2019ve had a chance to see and speak with have all been in a state of shell shock, understandably. Alondra is still in a state of shock, and she didn\u2019t really have much to talk about for this story as it\u2019s still to hard for her to recount. The day after the attack, she wrote a post on social media summarizing her feelings and has allowed me to republish it here:</p>\n<blockquote>\n<p>To my brothers and sisters who lost their lives during last night\u2019s attack my whole being is in pieces thinking of you - may God hold you in His grace. I will spend the rest of my life thanking God and my loved ones in heaven for protecting myself and Valerie during Sunday\u2019s attack and wondering how we managed to make it out. We ran with all we had and waited out the terror with individuals who became our family in those short hours. We cried and prayed together. I am not one to post on social media but I needed an opportunity to thank the First Responders who ran in as we ran out, Las Vegas PD who did their best to keep us safe and our loving family and friends who provided so many prayers, thoughts, text messages, calls, posts and love. Thank you to everyone, please know that your love can move mountains and I am eternally grateful.</p>\n\n<p>I don\u2019t understand and I don\u2019t think I ever will. I can\u2019t begin to explain how it felt. What we thought were fireworks at first turned into the most horrific moments of my life. When we made it to the roof I thought that we wouldn\u2019t make it back down alive because there was so much screaming from down below. One of the employees that was with us moved us to a crawlspace where we hid for about 2 hrs. We then had to crawl over the ac vents in the crawlspace to go down three flights of stairs to the casino floor. Once out we were told by swat to get out because there was a threat there. We ran outside with our hands up we only got about 20 steps when we heard screaming and were rushed back inside. We were then placed in a ballroom and kept there until 3am. I\u2019m beyond thankful and incredibly emotional, scared. Thank you for reaching out to me and thank you for your love. I know how lucky we both are and I\u2019ll never understand. God bless.</p>\n</blockquote>\n<p>Another Cast Member I spoke with (she preferred not to be named) who left Las Vegas just hours <em>before</em> the event, is in a similar state of shock \u2013 even awe \u2013 because of how close she came to being in the cross-fire. </p>\n\n<p>She spent her bachelorette party at the Mandalay Bay Hotel the night before the attack, staying the same dates as Mr. Paddock. On Sunday afternoon, a bridesmaid of hers \u2013 who was originally intending to attend the concert that evening with her \u2013 was too hungover from the night before, so they decided to head back to Orange County that afternoon. Hours later, when she heard about the shooting, her mind not only feared for those affected but also was stuck by how lucky she got, how close she had come to tragedy.</p>\n\n<p>Her story, and those of other cast members as well, have been an insight to the events on last Sunday for those of us here in Anaheim and around the country. Seeing how that day has impacted them has been eye opening to me, as no major mass shooting has come this close to home. Now that I\u2019ve seen, with my own yeas, the shocked faces; the bruises, cuts, and burns; and the thousand yard stares \u2013 for many days after the event \u2013 I\u2019ll never view these devastating events the same. </p>\n\n<p>I wish the best for all those affected, their families and those close to them.</p>\n\n<hr/>\n\n<p>On Tuesday evening, Iger <a href=\"http://www.latimes.com/business/hollywood/la-fi-ct-bob-iger-disney-vegas-shooting-jemele-hill-20171003-story.html\" rel=\"nofollow\">called out for action</a> against gun violence. From the LA Times article:</p>\n<blockquote class=\"large\">\n<p>Iger said he plans to retire from Disney in 2019. \u201cThis time I mean it,\u201d he said. Many people suspect he might be looking for a post-Disney career in politics.</p>\n</blockquote>\n<p>I would be very happy if Iger made his way into a state or even federal position. Hopefully his tenure at Disney, what\u2019s he\u2019s done for the company overall, and his actions especially in times of crisis like last week shows what he has to offer this country.</p>\n\n<hr/>\n<h3 id=\"disclaimer_3\">\n<a class=\"head_anchor\" href=\"#disclaimer_3\" rel=\"nofollow\">\u00a0</a>Disclaimer:</h3>\n<p>Although I work for The Walt Disney Company, this article is not on behalf of the company. &#13;\n\t<a href=\"https://dovu.io/\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\" target=\"_blank\">DOVU</a> is off to a flying start, raising over $5 million in Ether to date. The initiative aims to crowdsource high-quality transport data from large numbers of grassroots users, storing this on the blockchain and making it available to developers and companies in return for the DOV token. Access to these valuable datasets will drive innovation in the transport industry. <br/>&#13;\n</p>&#13;\n<p>&#13;\n\t DOVU\u2019s pre-sale was extremely successful, attracting a significant number of larger investors. This has placed the project in a strong position to go forwards: pre-sale contributions have already met the project\u2019s funding requirements for several years. The main crowd sale launched on Tuesday and any additional funding will permit an accelerated development timeline, along with an increased marketing spend. <br/>&#13;\n</p>&#13;\n<p>&#13;\n\t Unfortunately, the beginning of the public crowd sale saw an attack on DOVU\u2019s website. Many crowd sales are affected by high levels of traffic at their launch, as a lot of people try to access the site at the same time, and DOVU was well prepared for this. However, what occurred was a sustained and malicious DDoS attack that meant many users were unable to deposit funds for a period of several hours. Some of these contributors were unable to take advantage of the 10% bonus token period and DOVU took the step of extending the bonus phase for a further 12 hours. Making a copy of the stack and managing it &quot;manually&quot; probably means a lot of special scanning logic in the GC.", "Could you please explain which stack you are talking about here. If I am not wrong, Java language semantics does not have stack allocated variables, hence my confusion. I sampled the video at random offsets but could not find the location where coroutine implementation was discussed.", "It is the call stack that is being copied. It doesn&#x27;t have to do so much with stack allocated variables (which may be created in Java according to the whim of the compiler) but with capturing the current state of a computation in a relatively light weight manner, so that light weight threads &#x2F; coroutines can be saved and restored without the context switch and memory overhead of a full thread. This is basically the old &quot;green threads&quot; implementation used in the early JVMs.<p>The big idea behind this is the concept of a continuation, and a conversion between programs in &quot;direct style&quot; (the way you normally write them) and &quot;continuation passing style&quot; which makes control flow explicit. You could start reading here if interested: <a href=\"http:&#x2F;&#x2F;matt.might.net&#x2F;articles&#x2F;by-example-continuation-passing-style&#x2F;\" rel=\"nofollow\">http:&#x2F;&#x2F;matt.might.net&#x2F;articles&#x2F;by-example-continuation-passi...</a> Or read about how Scheme compilers work to support first class continuations, and the tricks you can play with them.", "That makes sense. I wasn&#x27;t sure which stack parent was referring to, stack of java activation records, the underlying C call stack of a JVM implemented in C.", "Java has a stack (it uses a stack based bytecode after all) which is used to hold arguments and so forth, and it has local variables whose values live on the stack. What it doesn&#x27;t have is object allocation on the stack - so if a local variable is a reference type then the object it refers to will be created on the heap.<p>Note the above only refers to the logical view of the language. A VM and JIT will have an ABI for method calls which may use registers to pass arguments (it may have several for interpreted and JITed code), and it can allocate objects purely on the stack if it can do good enough escape analysis.", "Either I&#x27;m being very dense, or something doesn&#x27;t quite make sense about these numbers.<p>The slides say that on the busiest day of the year, they were serving around 175,000 transactions per second (126k of which, or maybe additionally, were payments).<p>On the next slide it says they have &#x27;millions of JVMs&#x27; running an &#x27;insurmountable number&#x27; of requests.<p>Is each JVM really taking 10s+ per transaction? Even assuming those JVMs are split between servers, messaging, caching, database, etc, I don&#x27;t get why they need millions of them to handle c. 200k transactions per second.<p>Needless to say, I am not DevOps, so feel free to set me right.", "Each transaction is likely composed of hundreds of requests to various of subsystems, and each of them might have vastly different constraints. I don&#x27;t think the metric of average transactions across all JVMs they are running is a meaningful metric.", "There\u2019s probably a 10:1 or 100:1 page view to transaction ratio, and a 10:1 or 100:1 api request to page view ratio<p>200k transactions is a crazy number - a normal second for amazon is probably a few thousand orders (4-5k). This is 20x higher.", "This tweet suggests I\u2019m probably off by quite a bit (overestimating amazons orders)<p><a href=\"https:&#x2F;&#x2F;twitter.com&#x2F;joelcomm&#x2F;status&#x2F;917229394212675584\" rel=\"nofollow\">https:&#x2F;&#x2F;twitter.com&#x2F;joelcomm&#x2F;status&#x2F;917229394212675584</a><p>That\u2019s $3400&#x2F;second in transactions for amazon, and certainly their average price&#x2F;transaction is more than $1:1", "With microservices, anything is possible!", "Probably for non-transactional stuff I&#x27;m guessing. For every transaction there are probably 100 reads from various sources. Not to mention all the other stuff, from invoicing to reporting.", "Alibaba does a lot more than sell stuff on single&#x27;s day.", "Impressive stuff. I am particularly interested in how much AliOS deviates from mainline Linux.", "&gt; They have basically forked their entire backend stack, starting from the OS and moving upwards.<p>Isn&#x27;t this pretty common at the $XXX billion dollar tech companies like Google, Facebook, etc?", "Most likely, yes, but that doesn&#x27;t make it any less impressive", "I worked for Alipay, a subsidiary of Alibaba, around 2010. To achieve this, kernel devs sometimes cannot adopt the most optimized implementation because it may lead to unforeseen corner cases.<p>On the other hand, a company like Alibaba knows <i>exactly</i> what kind of machines and workloads they are dealing with, which means that they can make those optimizations and gain a slight performance boost relative to mainline Linux.", "&gt;Alibaba Runs Millions of Custom JVMs<p>&gt;They have basically forked their entire backend stack, starting from the OS and moving upwards.<p>I doubt this being a cool thing. Sure, they are the second biggest IT employer in the country, and have excess resources for everything, but...<p>A thing about big dotcoms - architects there try to use off-the-shelf software for everything, even if the software is clearly unsuited for the task and its use will require hacks and massive re-engineering.<p>Putting efforts to use of off-the-shelf software without modifications and hacks greatly reduces all aspects of infrastructure support burden.<p>BUT, attempting to use of off-the-shelf software everywhere at all costs, that will of course give you problems. And the bigger your are, the worse this is. They have done some amazing engineering work on jvm.", "&quot;Golang&quot; guys will be crying now!", "Where can I read more about WISP?", "Java is well suited to very large projects only because developers are &quot;commodity.&quot; With the modern language updates, the core java collections library is really broken for modern multi-paradigm programming. There are no true immutable collections in the core lib which makes Java really show its age with the newer language features compared to other more modern languages such as scala. Functions are bolted on as &quot;Single Abstract Method&quot; classes, which make functions essentially syntactic sugar instead of a first class language feature. Java9 makes some improvements but I wouldn&#x27;t consider using Java for any new projects unless I was at a big enterprise that can only hire really cheap developer and needs to hire a whole lot of em really fast.", "I fail to see the connection between cheap developers and Java not being a truly functional language (which it never claimed or tried to be).", "What kind of applications are you building that really require immutable collections and functional programming? J\ufffdwX\ufffd=\ufffd\ufffd&amp;ZXC\ufffdn\ufffd/\ufffd\ufffd8\ufffd&amp;\ufffd\ufffd?\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdQ*\ufffd\tc|\ufffd\u067f\ufffd\u03e0\ufffd\ufffdc\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdt\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdV\ufffd7\u0164\ufffd&amp;f\ufffdO;\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd&#13;\ufffd/B\ufffd\ufffd+\ufffdS\u04d6\ufffd7\ufffd\u007f\ufffdS\u03ee7\ufffd\t\ufffd\ufffd\u07d9\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd1b\ufffdI\ufffd\ufffd{D,\ufffd%\ufffdZ\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdI\ufffd\ufffd6L\ufffdf,\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdyEp\ufffd\tzX\ufffd!q07\ufffd\ufffdR\ufffdK\ufffdV=\ufffdnU`i{\ufffdMj{\ufffdk\ufffd}'MG\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd:7\ufffd3\ufffdF\ufffdEu;\ufffd\ufffd9\u0178\u05d7g\ufffd2\ufffd\u007fS\ufffdh\ufffdNk\ufffd\ufffdR&amp;\ufffdN\ufffd\u1e8c\ufffdr'\ufffdI\ufffdR\ufffd~7\ufffd\ufffd[\ufffdv\ufffd\u0252\u02c7\ufffdB\ufffddZ\ufffd\ufffd/\ufffdJj\u022fD\ufffd]h\ufffd\ufffd|\ufffdA\ufffd\ufffdm\ufffd5\ufffdR(!\ufffd\ufffd]\ufffd\ufffd=gpA\ufffd\ufffdxW\ufffd\ufffdh\ufffd\ufffd}\ufffda\ufffdd\ufffdx\ufffd&gt;\u03cd\ufffd</p></html></div></body></html>"}, "15429549": {"score": 1, "comments": [], "time": "2017-10-08 22:26:38", "url": "https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2017/09/02/upshot/fentanyl-drug-overdose-deaths.html", "text": "<html><body><div><div class=\"g-item g-text \">\n    \n\n      <p class=\"g-body\">Drug overdoses killed roughly 64,000 people in the United States last year, according to the first governmental <a href=\"https://www.cdc.gov/nchs/data/health_policy/monthly-drug-overdose-death-estimates.pdf\">account of nationwide drug deaths</a> to cover all of 2016. It\u2019s a staggering rise of more than 22 percent over the 52,404 drug deaths recorded the previous year \u2014 and even higher than The New York Times\u2019s <a href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2017/06/05/upshot/opioid-epidemic-drug-overdose-deaths-are-rising-faster-than-ever.html\">estimate</a> in June, which was based on earlier preliminary data.</p>\n\n\n    </div>\n\n    \n\n    \n      <div class=\"g-item g-text \">\n    \n\n      <p class=\"g-body\">Drug overdoses are expected to remain the leading cause of death for Americans under 50, as synthetic opioids \u2014 primarily fentanyl and its analogues \u2014 continue to push the death count higher. Drug deaths involving fentanyl more than doubled from 2015 to 2016, accompanied by an upturn in deaths involving cocaine and methamphetamine. Together they add up to an epidemic of drug overdoses that is killing people at a faster rate than the H.I.V. epidemic at its peak.</p>\n\n\n    </div>\n\n    \n\n    \n      <div class=\"g-item g-text \">\n    \n\n      <p class=\"g-body\">This is the first national data to break down the growth by drug and by state. We\u2019ve known for a while that fentanyls were behind the growing count of drug deaths in some states and counties. But now we can see the extent to which this is true nationally, as deaths involving synthetic opioids, mostly fentanyls, have risen to more than 20,000 from 3,000 in just three years.</p>\n\n\n    </div>\n\n    \n\n    \n      <div class=\"g-item g-text \">\n    \n\n      <p class=\"g-body\">Deaths involving prescription opioids continue to rise, but many of those deaths also involved heroin, fentanyl or a fentanyl analogue. There is a <a href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2017/08/03/upshot/opioid-drug-overdose-epidemic.html#question-3\">downward trend</a> in deaths from prescription opioids alone. At the same time, there has been a resurgence in cocaine and methamphetamine deaths. Many of these also involve opioids, but a significant portion of drug deaths \u2014 roughly one-third in 2015 \u2014 do not.</p>\n\n\n    </div>\n\n    \n\n    \n      <div class=\"g-item g-text g-indent\">\n    \n\n      <p class=\"g-body\">The explosion in fentanyl deaths and the persistence of widespread opioid addiction have swamped local and state resources. Communities say their budgets are being strained by the additional needs \u2014 for increased police and medical care, for widespread <a href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/as-opioid-overdoses-exact-a-higher-price-communities-ponder-who-should-be-saved/2017/07/15/1ea91890-67f3-11e7-8eb5-cbccc2e7bfbf_story.html\">naloxone</a> distribution and for a stronger <a href=\"http://www.pbs.org/newshour/rundown/opioid-crisis-strains-foster-care-system-programs-aim-keep-kids-mom/\">foster care</a> system that can handle the swelling number of neglected or orphaned children.</p>\n\n\n    </div>\n\n    \n\n    \n      <div class=\"g-item g-graphic g-offset\">\n    \n\n      <div class=\"g-item-ai2html\">\n\n\n  <p class=\"g-asset-hed\">Drug overdose deaths per 100,000 residents in 2015 and 2016</p>\n\n\n\n  <p class=\"g-leadin\">Of the 21 states that reported the highest quality data for 2016, the steepest rises were in Delaware, Florida and Maryland.</p>\n\n\n\n\n<p class=\"g-chart g-by-state\"/>\n \n\n\n<p class=\"g-asset-source\">\n  <span class=\"g-caption\">Note: Deaths were coded based on where the death occurred rather than residency.</span>\n  \n  \n</p>\n\n\n</div>\n\n\n    </div>\n\n    \n\n    \n      <div class=\"g-item g-text \">\n    \n\n      <p class=\"g-body\">It\u2019s an epidemic hitting different parts of the country in different ways. People are accustomed to thinking of the opioid crisis as a rural white problem, with accounts of <a href=\"http://www.newyorker.com/magazine/2017/06/05/the-addicts-next-door\">Appalachian despair</a> and the plight of <a href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2017/07/12/magazine/a-small-town-police-officers-war-on-drugs.html\">New England heroin addicts</a>. But fentanyls are changing the equation: The death rate in Maryland last year outpaced that in both Kentucky and Maine.</p>\n\n\n    </div>\n\n    \n\n    \n      <div class=\"g-item g-text \">\n    \n\n      <p class=\"g-body\">This <a href=\"https://www.cdc.gov/nchs/data/health_policy/monthly-drug-overdose-death-estimates.pdf\">provisional data</a>, compiled by the National Center for Health Statistics, was produced in response to requests from government officials after <a href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2017/06/05/upshot/opioid-epidemic-drug-overdose-deaths-are-rising-faster-than-ever.html\">reporting from The Times</a> in June. An early version of the report was posted online last month and will be formally published by the N.C.H.S. in the coming weeks. According to <a href=\"http://www.pop.psu.edu/robert-anderson\">Robert Anderson</a>, the agency\u2019s chief of mortality statistics, the document is the first edition of what will be a monthly report on the latest provisional overdose death counts.</p>\n\n\n    </div>\n\n    \n\n    \n      <div class=\"g-item g-text \">\n    \n\n      <p class=\"g-body\">Because of delays in drug death reporting, the data is mostly but not entirely complete. The final numbers, released in December, could be even higher.</p>\n\n\n    </div>\n\n    \n\n    \n      <div class=\"g-item g-text \">\n    \n\n      <p class=\"g-body\">It\u2019s too early to know what 2017 will hold, but anecdotal reports from state health departments and county coroners and medical examiners suggest that the overdose epidemic has continued to worsen. In March, President Trump <a href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2017/06/16/health/donald-trump-opioid-panel.html\">created a commission</a> to study the crisis. The <a href=\"https://www.whitehouse.gov/sites/whitehouse.gov/files/ondcp/commission-interim-report.pdf\">commission\u2019s interim report</a> made a number of recommendations, but the administration has <a href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2017/08/24/upshot/opioid-crisis-national-emergency.html\">yet to take concrete action</a> on any of them.</p>\n\n\n    </div>\n\n    \n\n  \n\n</div></body></html>"}, "15429552": {"score": 1, "comments": [], "time": "2017-10-08 22:27:01", "url": "https://www.getastra.com/blog/911/how-magecart-attackers-are-continuing-to-affect-e-commerce-platforms/?utm_campaign=shareaholic&utm_medium=yc_hacker_news&utm_source=news", "text": "<html><body><div><body id=\"readabilityBody\">\n<h1>Forbidden</h1>\n<p>You don't have permission to access /blog/911/how-magecart-attackers-are-continuing-to-affect-e-commerce-platforms/\non this server.<br/>\n</p>\n<p>Additionally, a 403 Forbidden\nerror was encountered while trying to use an ErrorDocument to handle the request.</p>\n</body></div></body></html>"}, "15429041": {"score": 12, "comments": ["Does this web app suport brain anatomy in detail, I mean naming each and every fissure and sulci? <b>R</b> Package for Quick Uncertainty Intervals</h1>\n<p><a href=\"/jthaman/ciTools/blob/master/lmer.png\" target=\"_blank\"><img src=\"/jthaman/ciTools/raw/master/lmer.png\" alt=\"lmer.png\"/></a></p>\n<h2><a href=\"#overview\" aria-hidden=\"true\" class=\"anchor\" id=\"user-content-overview\"><svg aria-hidden=\"true\" class=\"octicon octicon-link\" version=\"1.1\" viewbox=\"0 0 16 16\"><path fill-rule=\"evenodd\" d=\"M4 9h1v1H4c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5S2.55 3 4 3h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-.91 2.72-2 3.25V8.59c.58-.45 1-1.27 1-2.09C10 5.22 8.98 4 8 4H4c-.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5S3 9 4 9zm9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5S13.98 12 13 12H9c-.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-.83.42-1.64 1-2.09V6.25c-1.09.53-2 1.84-2 3.25C6 11.31 7.55 13 9 13h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5S14.5 6 13 6z\"/></svg></a>Overview</h2>\n<p><code>ciTools</code> is an <b>R</b> package that makes working with model uncertainty\n  as easy as possible. It gives the user easy access to confidence or\n  prediction intervals for the fitted values of (log-) linear models,\n  generalized linear models, and (log-) linear mixed\n  models. Additionally, we provide functions to determine\n  probabilities and quantiles of the conditional response\n  distribution given each of these models.</p>\n<h2><a href=\"#why-use-citools\" aria-hidden=\"true\" class=\"anchor\" id=\"user-content-why-use-citools\"><svg aria-hidden=\"true\" class=\"octicon octicon-link\" version=\"1.1\" viewbox=\"0 0 16 16\"><path fill-rule=\"evenodd\" d=\"M4 9h1v1H4c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5S2.55 3 4 3h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-.91 2.72-2 3.25V8.59c.58-.45 1-1.27 1-2.09C10 5.22 8.98 4 8 4H4c-.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5S3 9 4 9zm9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5S13.98 12 13 12H9c-.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-.83.42-1.64 1-2.09V6.25c-1.09.53-2 1.84-2 3.25C6 11.31 7.55 13 9 13h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5S14.5 6 13 6z\"/></svg></a>Why use <code>ciTools</code>?</h2>\n<p>Uncertainty intervals (confidence or prediction intervals) for\n  fitted values are easy enough if one is just working with linear\n  models, but when models become more complex, e.g. generalized\n  linear models or linear mixed models, the facilities for\n  quantifying uncertainty for predictions are either more cumbersome\n  to work with or nonexistent. We hope that <code>ciTools</code> provides uniform,\n  model invariant access to these statistics.</p>\n<h2><a href=\"#main-components\" aria-hidden=\"true\" class=\"anchor\" id=\"user-content-main-components\"><svg aria-hidden=\"true\" class=\"octicon octicon-link\" version=\"1.1\" viewbox=\"0 0 16 16\"><path fill-rule=\"evenodd\" d=\"M4 9h1v1H4c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5S2.55 3 4 3h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-.91 2.72-2 3.25V8.59c.58-.45 1-1.27 1-2.09C10 5.22 8.98 4 8 4H4c-.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5S3 9 4 9zm9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5S13.98 12 13 12H9c-.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-.83.42-1.64 1-2.09V6.25c-1.09.53-2 1.84-2 3.25C6 11.31 7.55 13 9 13h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5S14.5 6 13 6z\"/></svg></a>Main Components</h2>\n<p>This package has three main features that make it useful to <b>R</b> users:</p>\n<ul>\n  <li>Data frame first design - Easily pipe commands together (great for ggplot users)</li>\n  <li>Uniform syntax - all commands have that same simple syntax and sane defaults.</li>\n  <li>Generic design - One command for each statistical quantity</li>\n</ul>\n<h3><a href=\"#all-commands-in-citools\" aria-hidden=\"true\" class=\"anchor\" id=\"user-content-all-commands-in-citools\"><svg aria-hidden=\"true\" class=\"octicon octicon-link\" version=\"1.1\" viewbox=\"0 0 16 16\"><path fill-rule=\"evenodd\" d=\"M4 9h1v1H4c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5S2.55 3 4 3h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-.91 2.72-2 3.25V8.59c.58-.45 1-1.27 1-2.09C10 5.22 8.98 4 8 4H4c-.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5S3 9 4 9zm9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5S13.98 12 13 12H9c-.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-.83.42-1.64 1-2.09V6.25c-1.09.53-2 1.84-2 3.25C6 11.31 7.55 13 9 13h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5S14.5 6 13 6z\"/></svg></a>All commands in <code>ciTools</code>:</h3>\n<ul>\n  <li><code>add_ci(data, fit, ...)</code> - get confidence intervals and append to <code>data</code></li>\n  <li><code>add_pi(data, fit, ...)</code> - get prediction intervals and append to <code>data</code></li>\n  <li><code>add_probs(data, fit, q, ...)</code> - get conditional response probabilities, Pr(Response|Covariates &lt; <code>q</code>)</li>\n  <li><code>add_quantile(data, fit, p, ...)</code> - get conditional response quantiles at level <code>p</code></li>\n</ul>\n<h2><a href=\"#installation\" aria-hidden=\"true\" class=\"anchor\" id=\"user-content-installation\"><svg aria-hidden=\"true\" class=\"octicon octicon-link\" version=\"1.1\" viewbox=\"0 0 16 16\"><path fill-rule=\"evenodd\" d=\"M4 9h1v1H4c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5S2.55 3 4 3h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-.91 2.72-2 3.25V8.59c.58-.45 1-1.27 1-2.09C10 5.22 8.98 4 8 4H4c-.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5S3 9 4 9zm9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5S13.98 12 13 12H9c-.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-.83.42-1.64 1-2.09V6.25c-1.09.53-2 1.84-2 3.25C6 11.31 7.55 13 9 13h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5S14.5 6 13 6z\"/></svg></a>Installation</h2>\n<p>Install from CRAN:</p>\n<div class=\"highlight highlight-source-r\"><pre>install.packages(<span class=\"pl-s\"><span class=\"pl-pds\">\"</span>ciTools<span class=\"pl-pds\">\"</span></span>)\nlibrary(<span class=\"pl-smi\">ciTools</span>)</pre></div>\n<p>Install <code>ciTools</code> from Github with <code>devtools</code>:</p>\n<div class=\"highlight highlight-source-r\"><pre>library(<span class=\"pl-smi\">devtools</span>)\n<span class=\"pl-e\">devtools</span><span class=\"pl-k\">::</span>install_github(<span class=\"pl-s\"><span class=\"pl-pds\">\"</span>jthaman/ciTools<span class=\"pl-pds\">\"</span></span>)\nlibrary(<span class=\"pl-smi\">ciTools</span>)</pre></div>\n<p>If you are behind a corporate firewall, you may have to instead run:</p>\n<div class=\"highlight highlight-source-r\"><pre>library(<span class=\"pl-smi\">httr</span>)\nlibrary(<span class=\"pl-smi\">devtools</span>)\n<span class=\"pl-e\">httr</span><span class=\"pl-k\">::</span>set_config(config(<span class=\"pl-v\">ssl_verifypeer</span> <span class=\"pl-k\">=</span> <span class=\"pl-c1\">FALSE</span>)) \n<span class=\"pl-e\">devtools</span><span class=\"pl-k\">::</span>install_github(<span class=\"pl-s\"><span class=\"pl-pds\">\"</span>jthaman/ciTools<span class=\"pl-pds\">\"</span></span>)\n<span class=\"pl-e\">httr</span><span class=\"pl-k\">::</span>set_config(config(<span class=\"pl-v\">ssl_verifypeer</span> <span class=\"pl-k\">=</span> <span class=\"pl-c1\">TRUE</span>)) \nlibrary(<span class=\"pl-smi\">ciTools</span>)</pre></div>\n<h2><a href=\"#usage\" aria-hidden=\"true\" class=\"anchor\" id=\"user-content-usage\"><svg aria-hidden=\"true\" class=\"octicon octicon-link\" version=\"1.1\" viewbox=\"0 0 16 16\"><path fill-rule=\"evenodd\" d=\"M4 9h1v1H4c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5S2.55 3 4 3h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-.91 2.72-2 3.25V8.59c.58-.45 1-1.27 1-2.09C10 5.22 8.98 4 8 4H4c-.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5S3 9 4 9zm9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5S13.98 12 13 12H9c-.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-.83.42-1.64 1-2.09V6.25c-1.09.53-2 1.84-2 3.25C6 11.31 7.55 13 9 13h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5S14.5 6 13 6z\"/></svg></a>Usage</h2>\n<p>Here is a short example featuring a linear mixed model, but the\n  idea is the same for any other model.</p>\n<div class=\"highlight highlight-source-r\"><pre><span class=\"pl-c\"><span class=\"pl-c\">#</span># Example with a linear mixed model</span>\n\nlibrary(<span class=\"pl-smi\">ciTools</span>)\nlibrary(<span class=\"pl-smi\">lme4</span>)\nlibrary(<span class=\"pl-smi\">tidyverse</span>)\n\n<span class=\"pl-smi\">dat</span> <span class=\"pl-k\">&lt;-</span> <span class=\"pl-smi\">sleepstudy</span> <span class=\"pl-c\"><span class=\"pl-c\">#</span># data included with lme4</span>\n<span class=\"pl-c\"><span class=\"pl-c\">#</span># Fit a random intercept model</span>\n<span class=\"pl-smi\">fit</span> <span class=\"pl-k\">&lt;-</span> lmer(<span class=\"pl-smi\">Reaction</span> <span class=\"pl-k\">~</span> <span class=\"pl-smi\">Days</span> <span class=\"pl-k\">+</span> (<span class=\"pl-c1\">1</span> <span class=\"pl-k\">|</span> <span class=\"pl-smi\">Subject</span>), <span class=\"pl-v\">data</span> <span class=\"pl-k\">=</span> <span class=\"pl-smi\">dat</span>)\n\n<span class=\"pl-c\"><span class=\"pl-c\">#</span># New data for predictions</span>\n<span class=\"pl-c\"><span class=\"pl-c\">#</span># A random sample of 20 observations from sleepstudy</span>\n<span class=\"pl-smi\">new_dat</span> <span class=\"pl-k\">&lt;-</span> <span class=\"pl-smi\">sleepstudy</span>[sample(NROW(<span class=\"pl-smi\">dat</span>), <span class=\"pl-c1\">20</span>),]\n\n<span class=\"pl-c\"><span class=\"pl-c\">#</span># Append (conditional) 50% CIs and PIs to the new data:</span>\n<span class=\"pl-smi\">new_dat</span> <span class=\"pl-k\">&lt;-</span> add_ci(<span class=\"pl-smi\">new_dat</span>, <span class=\"pl-smi\">fit</span>, <span class=\"pl-v\">alpha</span> <span class=\"pl-k\">=</span> <span class=\"pl-c1\">0.5</span>) %<span class=\"pl-k\">&gt;</span>%\n    add_pi(<span class=\"pl-smi\">fit</span>, <span class=\"pl-v\">alpha</span> <span class=\"pl-k\">=</span> <span class=\"pl-c1\">0.5</span>)\n\n<span class=\"pl-c\"><span class=\"pl-c\">#</span># Append 50% CIs and PIs, but ignore the random effects:</span>\nadd_ci(<span class=\"pl-smi\">new_dat</span>, <span class=\"pl-smi\">fit</span>, <span class=\"pl-v\">alpha</span> <span class=\"pl-k\">=</span> <span class=\"pl-c1\">0.5</span>, <span class=\"pl-v\">includeRanef</span> <span class=\"pl-k\">=</span> <span class=\"pl-c1\">FALSE</span>,\n       <span class=\"pl-v\">names</span> <span class=\"pl-k\">=</span> c(<span class=\"pl-s\"><span class=\"pl-pds\">\"</span>lcb_uncond<span class=\"pl-pds\">\"</span></span>, <span class=\"pl-s\"><span class=\"pl-pds\">\"</span>ucb_uncond<span class=\"pl-pds\">\"</span></span>), <span class=\"pl-c\"><span class=\"pl-c\">#</span># custom interval names</span>\n       <span class=\"pl-v\">yhatName</span> <span class=\"pl-k\">=</span> <span class=\"pl-s\"><span class=\"pl-pds\">\"</span>pred_uncond<span class=\"pl-pds\">\"</span></span>) %<span class=\"pl-k\">&gt;</span>%\n    add_pi(<span class=\"pl-smi\">fit</span>, <span class=\"pl-v\">alpha</span> <span class=\"pl-k\">=</span> <span class=\"pl-c1\">0.5</span>, <span class=\"pl-v\">includeRanef</span> <span class=\"pl-k\">=</span> <span class=\"pl-c1\">FALSE</span>,\n           <span class=\"pl-v\">names</span> <span class=\"pl-k\">=</span> c(<span class=\"pl-s\"><span class=\"pl-pds\">\"</span>lpb_uncond<span class=\"pl-pds\">\"</span></span>, <span class=\"pl-s\"><span class=\"pl-pds\">\"</span>upb_uncond<span class=\"pl-pds\">\"</span></span>))\n\n<span class=\"pl-c\"><span class=\"pl-c\">#</span># Determine the probability that a new Reaction time will be less</span>\n<span class=\"pl-c\"><span class=\"pl-c\">#</span># than 300 (given the model and new data):</span>\nadd_probs(<span class=\"pl-smi\">new_dat</span>, <span class=\"pl-smi\">fit</span>, <span class=\"pl-c1\">300</span>)\n\n<span class=\"pl-c\"><span class=\"pl-c\">#</span># Or greater than:</span>\nadd_probs(<span class=\"pl-smi\">new_dat</span>, <span class=\"pl-smi\">fit</span>, <span class=\"pl-c1\">300</span>, <span class=\"pl-v\">comparison</span> <span class=\"pl-k\">=</span> <span class=\"pl-s\"><span class=\"pl-pds\">\"</span>&gt;<span class=\"pl-pds\">\"</span></span>)\n\n<span class=\"pl-c\"><span class=\"pl-c\">#</span># Determine the 0.9-quantile of the predictive distribution, given the</span>\n<span class=\"pl-c\"><span class=\"pl-c\">#</span># model and new data:</span>\nadd_quantile(<span class=\"pl-smi\">new_dat</span>, <span class=\"pl-smi\">fit</span>, <span class=\"pl-c1\">0.9</span>)\n</pre></div>\n<p>The end result is a data frame that is amenable to plotting with\n  ggplot2. See the documentation for more examples with other types\n  of statistical regression models.</p>\n<h2><a href=\"#scope-of-citools\" aria-hidden=\"true\" class=\"anchor\" class=\"story-body-text story-content\" data-para-count=\"347\" data-total-count=\"8076\">Examining cadavers, he said, as he removed the three pairs of gloves (two made of latex, one of Kevlar) that protect him during autopsies from blood-borne diseases, \u201cis profound, profound work.\u201d But, he said, it has only affirmed for him the view of the philosopher Thomas Hobbes, who called the
